name: Aorta
desc:
Is there a AAA (abdominal aorta > 3 cm)?
Are there an aneurysm (iliac arteries > 1.5 cm)?
Is there an aortic dissection?

name: Cardiac
desc:
What is the global function/contractility?
Is there cardiac activity?
Is there pericardial effusion?
Are there signs of RV strain?

name: DVT
desc:
Does the common femoral vein fully compress?
Does the Popliteal vein fully compress?

name: EFAST
desc:
Is there free fluid in the abdomen?
Is there fluid/blood in the pericardium?
Is there blood in the thorax?
Is there pneumothorax?

name: Gallbladder
desc:
Are there gallstones?
Is there a Murphy's sign?
Is there thickening of the common bile duct or anterior wall?
Is there pericholecystic fluid?

name: HIMAP
desc:
Is the patient in shock?
Is there evidence of pulmonary embolism or pneumonia?
Are there signs of MI or cardiac tamponade?

name: IVC
desc:
Is the IVC < 1.5 cm or > 2.5 cm?
Does the IVC collapse >50% with respiration?

name: OB 1 Timester
desc:
Is there a yolk sac?
Is there an IUP?

name: OB 2/3 Timester
desc:
Is there a viable intrauterine pregnancy?
Is there sufficient amniotic fluid?
Is the cervix open or closed?

name: Ocular
desc:
Is the optic nerve sheath > 5 mm?
Is there retinal detachment or vitrious hemorrhage?
Is there other ocular pathology?

name: Genitourinary
desc:
Is there hydronephrosis?
Is the bladder distended?

name: Soft Tissue/MSK
desc:
Is there a fluid collection?
Is there cellultis or an abscess?
Is there a fracture, tendon injury, joint effusion, or foreign body?

name: Thoracic
desc:
Is the lung normal?
Is there acute interstitial syndrome?
Is there pleural effusion?
Is there infiltrate or consolidation?
